title: LLMs: a growing habit with an added burden?
content:
I was reading a recent MIT study about accumulation of cognitive debt in GPT users, which lead to thinking about habit-forming.

It is my personal opinion that the best use case of modern LLMs is gathering information on topics you know little about. It is GOOD at giving you the relevant information - so good that an LLM has been my go-to for understanding new things lately.
As I was happily able to | grep(if you may ðŸ˜Š)new info, something concerning occurred to me - "is this info reliable and complete?" To verify this, I would ask the model to search for and cite sources, and then personally tap them for verification. Had I done a search for the relevant info, I could have gone straight to the source and just read that.

It becomes important to perform a fact-check when dealing with nuances in a regime you know little about. Apart from the distrust in completeness and authenticity of information that LLMs can furnish us with, there's a certain vibe to well-structured stackoverflow posts and good old blogs, that I do not see in LLMs - that human element.

From a user's perspective, I would not be comfortable to have LLMs(or LLM-driven search engines for that matter) replace a search on the web and books, for dealing with nuanced topics just YET.
As for getting an introduction to new ideas, LLMs are a life-saver!



P.S. No AI was used in crafting this post - you are likely to find deficiencies in the post upon closer inspection ðŸ˜‚

title: Astropoetry
content:
Submitted for Global Astronomy Month 2018 to astronomerswithoutborders.org
I wrote this one long ago, please exercise leniency in judgement lol

The Brahmand-Space





Space is humongously vast,
what we see in the sky now is only its past.It is like a fabric, in combination with time,
that is bent by stars, planets and all matter.
Twenty-seven percent of it is what we call "Dark Matter",
that mainly causes matter to gather.
Sixty-eight percent of it is "Dark Energy",
that's accelerating its expansion in a ravishing flamboyancy.
One thing to physicists is pissing-
That a lot of the predicted antimatter in space is missing!
A "Black Hole" formed from a neutron star, is a mighty dark and dense beast,
to whom the nearby matter and light is like a feast.
Some Black Holes are stationary loners
while some are spinning interstellar voyagers.
You and me and everyone are of the same age,
for all of the matter formed and existed long before ice age!
The Universe and us are all thirteen point eight billon years old,
and that's how the story should be usually told.
Comets are Curious and adventurous rocks, with icy tales.
Some are even doting,
for after travelling for hundreds of thousands of miles,
they do return to visit us again, but
they go away once again.
The existence of aliens is a COLASSAL question.
As the Tesla Roadster zips through space,
we can ONLY HOPE that it is found by an advanced extraterrestrial race.
UNTIL we ourselves, BUILD a Dyson Sphere to power advanced rocketry
that'll make of our current rockets a complete Mockery.

Such is the Beauty and Diversity of our UNI-VERSE,
which may be dwelling in a MULTI-VERSE.
